item.title: Used Underwear Vendors and Assumptions About Smart Contracts
item.description:
Used Underwear Vendors and Assumptions About Smart Contracts

When doing new things, it is not uncommon to find completely unanticipated results. The recent events impacting TheDAO have opened my eyes to a reality that is very contrary to the one I thought I knew. Why are we interested in smart contracts and what really is their value?

item.title: Australian 'bitcoin founder' quietly bidding for patent empire
item.description:
Australian 'bitcoin founder' quietly bidding for patent empire

SYDNEY/SINGAPORE Craig Wright, the Australian who claimed to be the inventor of bitcoin, is attempting to build a large patent portfolio around the digital currency and technology underpinning it, according to associates of his and documents reviewed by Reuters.

item.title: Bitcoin Acceptance by WB21 Was Bound to Happen, Others May Follow - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Bitcoin Acceptance by WB21 Was Bound to Happen, Others May Follow - NEWSBTC

The Digital bank WB21 recently announced that it will be accepting bitcoin deposits. As the popularity of bitcoin increases, we can expect more banks to follow suit. Bitcoin and the banking sector do not go well together - it is a known fact.

item.title: What Are the Use Cases for Private Blockchains? The Experts Weigh In
item.description:
What Are the Use Cases for Private Blockchains? The Experts Weigh In

Many people argue that private blockchains, run by private firms, are useless, since they make users dependent upon a third party â€’ the firm managing the blockchain. Many believe that private blockchains currently being considered are not blockchains, but rather, distributed ledger technology which has already existed.

item.title: Bitcoin node Decentralization
item.description:
Bitcoin node Decentralization

Yes, independently operated nodes help decentralization more than the same number of nodes operated by a single entity. That's basically the definition of "decentralization" in this context. That is not to say that a single organization running multiple full nodes does not add to overall network health, since those nodes still participate in relaying transactions and providing historical blocks.

item.title: Simplefx - Trade in the World Markets Anonymously by Using your Bitcoin - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Simplefx - Trade in the World Markets Anonymously by Using your Bitcoin - NEWSBTC

Lately trading with a leverage of not only BTC\USD or LTC\USD is getting popular but also usual Forex stocks and commodities. Today we will take a look at one of the most well-known and advanced sites in this the Forex trading Industry offering the biggest leverage option on the market.

item.title: Blockchain & Smart Contracts Could Spell Doom for Corporate Law Firms
item.description:
Blockchain & Smart Contracts Could Spell Doom for Corporate Law Firms

Australia's top law firms are preparing themselves for the disruption of blockchain-led 'smart contracts' with the technology expected to threaten thousands of jobs and the role of lawyers' intermediating commercial negotiations and disputes that will soon be automated by computers.

item.title: $19 Million in Bitcoin Hits the Auction Block in Australia - CoinDesk
item.description:
$19 Million in Bitcoin Hits the Auction Block in Australia - CoinDesk

More than $19m worth of the digital currency bitcoin is now being sold at auction in an event overseen by professional services firm Ernst & Young. Announced on 30th May, the auction finds E&Y auctioning 25,518 BTC (worth roughly $19m at press time) over a 48-hour period that began at 12:01am AEST today.

item.title: Where Goes Ether After DAO Drama: Bears Rule But Pivot May Be Near
item.description:
Where Goes Ether After DAO Drama: Bears Rule But Pivot May Be Near

While bitcoin treads water in the mid-$750's following another bullish week, Ether has been getting some less flattering attention. Early Friday morning the cryptocurrency based project known as the DAO ("Decentralized Autonomous Organization") was exploited for about 3.5 million Ethers, equivalent to around $50 million USD via a quirk in the code related to child DAO's.

item.description:
Should bitcoin be illegal?
